eg.projects

Class ProjectConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.projects.ProjectConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlActions, JavaActions, PerlActions

    public abstract class ProjectConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable
    Represents the configuration of a project.

    Class works in combination with SettingsWin where the name of a project file and optionally names of sub-directories and some other properties are entered.

    The root folder of the project is not specified explicitely in the settings window but the directory of a file that is part of the project (and which is not necessarily the main project file) is passed in as an argument in configureProject(String). It is tested if the main project file whose name is entered in the settings window exists in this directory or possibly further upwards in the path of this directory. The main project file may also be found in sub-directories relative to the supposed root. These must be specified in the settings window and have the order 'sourcesDirName'/'moduleName' if both of these properties are specified. However, the name of the root may be entered in the settings window to require that the found root directory has this name.

    The configuration of a project is stored in the prefs file of the program and optionally in a 'config' file that is saved in the project's root folder. A stored project may be retrieved using retrieveProject(String) in which the directory of any file that is part of the project may be passed in.

      • retrieveProject

        public boolean retrieveProject(java.lang.String dir)
        If a project stored in a preferences file can be retrieved

        Method first looks for an 'eadconfig' file in dir or in parents of it and, if this is not present, in the preferences file in the program folder.

        Specified by:
        retrieveProject in interface Configurable
        Parameters:

        Returns:
